line_1: BRIGHT emanation of all right'ous power,
line_2: Religion! bear me to thy sacred bower;

line_1: Religion! bear me to thy sacred bower;

line_1: Where fix'd in faith, by holy patience bless'd,
line_2: Calm resignation yields the wretched rest;

line_1: Calm resignation yields the wretched rest;
line_2: Where fix'd in faith, by holy patience bless'd,

line_1: Where hope divine to penitence is given,
line_2: Beams in each breast, and lists the soul to heaven.

line_1: Beams in each breast, and lists the soul to heaven.
line_2: Where hope divine to penitence is given,

line_1: Ye sons of shew, ye unreflecting gay,
line_2: Time-trifling youth, the splendors of a day;

line_1: Time-trifling youth, the splendors of a day;
line_2: Ye sons of shew, ye unreflecting gay,

line_1: Who lightly bounding o'er life's surface skim,
line_2: Monarchs of mode, and worshippers of whim.

line_1: Monarchs of mode, and worshippers of whim.
line_2: Who lightly bounding o'er life's surface skim,

line_1: Thus, thro' the air, the wing-poiz'd warbler sings;
line_2: Wanton thus flies, display their painted wings:

line_1: Wanton thus flies, display their painted wings:
line_2: Thus, thro' the air, the wing-poiz'd warbler sings;

line_1: So struts the fowl, with eye-bespangled train,
line_2: Like you self pleas'd; as pretty, and — as vain.

line_1: Like you self pleas'd; as pretty, and — as vain.
line_2: So struts the fowl, with eye-bespangled train,

line_1: The time must come when dress and dancing's o'er,
line_2: And your frail forms can play the fool no more:

line_1: And your frail forms can play the fool no more:
line_2: The time must come when dress and dancing's o'er,

line_1: E'er 'tis too late, look with religious eyes;
line_2: Think, think, ye faulty, and be timely wise.

line_1: Think, think, ye faulty, and be timely wise.
line_2: E'er 'tis too late, look with religious eyes;

line_1: Ye tender, lovely, love-inspiring race,
line_2: Whose words are music, and whose motion grace;

line_1: Whose words are music, and whose motion grace;
line_2: Ye tender, lovely, love-inspiring race,

line_1: Whose soft endearing looks insidious play,
line_2: Feast the fond eye, and snatch the soul away.

line_1: Feast the fond eye, and snatch the soul away.
line_2: Whose soft endearing looks insidious play,

line_1: Ye laughing sex, who vainly wanton, rove
line_2: Thro' the Elysium of unbounded love:

line_1: Thro' the Elysium of unbounded love:
line_2: Ye laughing sex, who vainly wanton, rove

line_2: Watch the soft smile, and catch the glancing eye;

line_1: Watch the soft smile, and catch the glancing eye;

line_1: Still must you lose this sense-ensnaring form,
line_2: And what now feeds your lover, feast a worm.

line_1: And what now feeds your lover, feast a worm.
line_2: Still must you lose this sense-ensnaring form,

line_1: Yet, yet, ye conscious beauty-beaming train,
line_2: A moment think; then, if ye dare, — be vain.

line_1: A moment think; then, if ye dare, — be vain.
line_2: Yet, yet, ye conscious beauty-beaming train,

line_1: Dispassion'd race! ye wealthy slaves of care,
line_2: Whose cheeks ne'er felt the trickling, tender tear;

line_1: Whose cheeks ne'er felt the trickling, tender tear;
line_2: Dispassion'd race! ye wealthy slaves of care,

line_1: Whose breasts ne'er heav'd with sympathetic sigh;
line_2: Whose hearts ne'er open'd to the asking eye.

line_1: Whose hearts ne'er open'd to the asking eye.
line_2: Whose breasts ne'er heav'd with sympathetic sigh;

line_1: Ye sons of trade, ye busy tasteless train,
line_2: Whose God is gold, and whose religion gain;

line_1: Whose God is gold, and whose religion gain;
line_2: Ye sons of trade, ye busy tasteless train,

line_1: Your greedy minds, to social joys unknown,
line_2: In one, dull, drudging round, rowl restless on.

line_1: In one, dull, drudging round, rowl restless on.
line_2: Your greedy minds, to social joys unknown,

line_1: Can you expect a charity from Heav'n?
line_2: Shall you! ye stubborn hearted, be forgiv'n?

line_1: Shall you! ye stubborn hearted, be forgiv'n?
line_2: Can you expect a charity from Heav'n?

line_1: Fruitless your sighs, repentant, will appear;
line_2: You'll want that mercy you derided here;

line_1: You'll want that mercy you derided here;
line_2: Fruitless your sighs, repentant, will appear;

line_1: Unmov'd the Godhead will your sorrows view,
line_2: As weeping want, on earth, was seen by you.

line_1: As weeping want, on earth, was seen by you.
line_2: Unmov'd the Godhead will your sorrows view,

line_1: Star-lustred breasts, ye court-delectant race,
line_2: Ye souls of honour, and ye sons of place,

line_1: Ye souls of honour, and ye sons of place,
line_2: Star-lustred breasts, ye court-delectant race,

line_1: Big with each blessing that attends a throne,
line_2: On the low wealthless look contemptuous down:

line_1: On the low wealthless look contemptuous down:
line_2: Big with each blessing that attends a throne,

line_1: Yet, spite of pride, the statesman and the slave.
line_2: Rise, undistinguish'd, from the equal grave. —

line_1: Rise, undistinguish'd, from the equal grave. —
line_2: Yet, spite of pride, the statesman and the slave.

line_1: Go search within for all ennobled earth;
line_2: Go teach the tomb-bred worm respect to birth

line_1: Go teach the tomb-bred worm respect to birth

line_1: Correct his feeding, and refine his taste:
line_2: Courtiers and clowns compose alike his feast

line_2: The glare of titles, or the vulgar's gaze,

line_1: When worn-out nature panting gasps for breath,
line_2: And friends fly, frighted, from the face of death?

line_1: And friends fly, frighted, from the face of death?
line_2: When worn-out nature panting gasps for breath,

line_1: "To the sad sense what then can give content"
line_2: "The sweet reflection of a life well spent."

line_1: "The sweet reflection of a life well spent."

line_1: Calm each great soul quits his clay-cumb'rous load.
line_2: Springs to the skies, and humbly waits his God.

line_1: Springs to the skies, and humbly waits his God.
line_2: Calm each great soul quits his clay-cumb'rous load.

line_1: While the low wretch, by crime rais'd wealth-grown great,
line_2: Starts at life's loss; and, frightful, meets his fate;

line_1: Starts at life's loss; and, frightful, meets his fate;
line_2: While the low wretch, by crime rais'd wealth-grown great,

line_1: Wide-op'ning, wild he rowls his ghastful eyes:
line_2: He shakes; he shrinks; and, agonizing, cries,

line_1: He shakes; he shrinks; and, agonizing, cries,
line_2: Wide-op'ning, wild he rowls his ghastful eyes:

line_1: "Have mercy, Heav'n! — Can I its mercy share?

line_1: " See! grief-stab'd merit opes its bosom there:
line_2: "Have mercy, Heav'n! — Can I its mercy share?

line_1: What shall we say in that great day of dread,
line_2: When the rent graves shall render back their dead?

line_1: When the rent graves shall render back their dead?

line_1: When, at the trumpet's sound, the clouds give way,
line_2: And the world blazes in eternal day?

line_1: And the world blazes in eternal day?
line_2: When, at the trumpet's sound, the clouds give way,

line_1: There the fierce tyrant feels th' avenging rod,
line_2: And pride sinks trembling at the sight of God;

line_1: And pride sinks trembling at the sight of God;
line_2: There the fierce tyrant feels th' avenging rod,

line_1: There suff'ring virtue happiness receives;
line_2: There the fool'd atheist, tho' too late, believes:

line_1: There the fool'd atheist, tho' too late, believes:
line_2: There suff'ring virtue happiness receives;

line_1: The poor lost sinner hears th' eternal doom;
line_2: And, woe appall'd, clings shudd'ring to his tomb.

line_1: And, woe appall'd, clings shudd'ring to his tomb.
line_2: The poor lost sinner hears th' eternal doom;

line_2: Command your slain, ye heroes, from their shrouds;

line_1: Command your slain, ye heroes, from their shrouds;
line_2: Bring, ye bright fair, your love-attending crouds;

line_1: Ye prime in state display your deepest schemes;
line_2: And, ye nice wits, your fancy-forming dreams;

line_1: And, ye nice wits, your fancy-forming dreams;
line_2: Ye prime in state display your deepest schemes;

line_1: Try, try, ye proud, in that tremendous hour,
line_2: The skill of science, or the strength of pow'r,

line_1: The skill of science, or the strength of pow'r,

line_1: Self-pleasing wisdom, the renown of birth,
line_2: All, all the vis'onary joys of earth;

line_1: All, all the vis'onary joys of earth;

line_1: Lay them before the universal Lord;
line_2: Go, plead your merits, and revoke his word.

line_1: Go, plead your merits, and revoke his word.

line_2: Or gloworms dim the sun's refulgent rays.

line_2: But prov'd no doctrine by the dint of sword.

line_1: But prov'd no doctrine by the dint of sword.

line_2: Yet threaten'd no damnation to the rest.

line_1: Yet threaten'd no damnation to the rest.

line_1: Plain and unsully'd, like the simple maid,
line_2: Religion bloom'd, by int'rest unallay'd:

line_1: Religion bloom'd, by int'rest unallay'd:
line_2: Plain and unsully'd, like the simple maid,

line_1: Leal truly servent, penitence sincere,
line_2: Bill'd the wrap'd soul, and spoke the heart-selt pray'r.

line_1: Bill'd the wrap'd soul, and spoke the heart-selt pray'r.
line_2: Leal truly servent, penitence sincere,

line_1: Then social bliss descended from above,
line_2: Spread thro' each sex, and ripen'd into love:

line_1: Spread thro' each sex, and ripen'd into love:
line_2: Then social bliss descended from above,

line_1: No feign'd desires fed th' heavenly flame;
line_2: Pure blaz'd the passion, as from God it came:

line_1: Pure blaz'd the passion, as from God it came:
line_2: No feign'd desires fed th' heavenly flame;

line_1: All beings then with mutual rapture strove;
line_2: Love was religion; and religion, love.

line_1: Love was religion; and religion, love.
line_2: All beings then with mutual rapture strove;

line_1: Ye motley sons, compos'd of noise and shew;
line_2: Ye beauty-haunting, gingling, glitt'ring crew

line_1: Ye beauty-haunting, gingling, glitt'ring crew
line_2: Ye motley sons, compos'd of noise and shew;

line_1: Tho' round the fair you ever fondly rove;
line_2: Think not, insipids, you were form'd for love.

line_1: Think not, insipids, you were form'd for love.
line_2: Tho' round the fair you ever fondly rove;

line_1: Scorn worldly wealth, ye pray'r-deliv'ring race,
line_2: Heav'n equal hears — equal dispenses place:

line_1: Heav'n equal hears — equal dispenses place:
line_2: Scorn worldly wealth, ye pray'r-deliv'ring race,

line_1: With soul-felt awe adore all nature's Lord;
line_2: Boldly proclaim his wonder-working word:

line_1: Boldly proclaim his wonder-working word:
line_2: With soul-felt awe adore all nature's Lord;

line_1: Snatch the smooth mask from the rich sinner's face;
line_2: Check the gay vicious in their guilty race:

line_1: Check the gay vicious in their guilty race:
line_2: Snatch the smooth mask from the rich sinner's face;

line_1: Humble the haughty, bend the scoffer down,
line_2: And scourge the shameless, tho' the pow'rful frown.

line_1: And scourge the shameless, tho' the pow'rful frown.
line_2: Humble the haughty, bend the scoffer down,

line_2: Assist the friendless, and protect the poor:

line_1: Assist the friendless, and protect the poor:
line_2: Raise, tho' in rags, and lend the wretched cure,

line_1: Bounteous, o'er earth, the sun bestows his rays,
line_2: Shines o'er a throne, and thro' the cottage plays:

line_2: Pure you receive, return it unallay'd:

line_1: Pure you receive, return it unallay'd:
line_2: Bounteous thus Heav'n the gospel-light has spread;

line_1: Shun the mean wrangling, syllogistic rules;
line_2: Scorn quibbling logic, and the modes of schools;

line_1: Scorn quibbling logic, and the modes of schools;
line_2: Shun the mean wrangling, syllogistic rules;

line_2: And act with ardour up to what you teach.

line_1: And act with ardour up to what you teach.
line_2: Free from dull, learned jargon, plainly preach,

line_2: As the bell tolls for church — to fall asleep.

line_2: And treat the temple as you use the court.

line_1: And treat the temple as you use the court.

line_1: Blush the meek beauty in her hour of pray'r.
line_2: Ye senseless rude who, with affrontive stare,

line_2: Prettily pacing thro' the sounding isle;

line_1: Prettily pacing thro' the sounding isle;
line_2: Ye empty idlings, who insipid smile,

line_1: Devotion's hour, loit'ring, laugh away;
line_2: Too nice to kneel, and much too proud to pray

line_1: Too nice to kneel, and much too proud to pray

line_1: No more, ye vain, the sacred dome debase,
line_2: Wanton with worship, and your God disgrace,

line_1: Wanton with worship, and your God disgrace,
line_2: No more, ye vain, the sacred dome debase,

line_1: With me fall prostrate — penitent adore;
line_2: Confess your errors, and offend no more.

line_1: Confess your errors, and offend no more.
line_2: With me fall prostrate — penitent adore;

line_1: By chance condemn'd to wander from my birth
line_2: An erring exile, o'er the face of earth,

line_1: An erring exile, o'er the face of earth,
line_2: By chance condemn'd to wander from my birth

line_1: Wild thro' the world of vice; — licentious race! —
line_2: I've started folly, and enjoy'd the chace:

line_1: I've started folly, and enjoy'd the chace:
line_2: Wild thro' the world of vice; — licentious race! —

line_1: Pleas'd with each passion, I pursu'd their aim,
line_2: Cheer'd the gay pack, and grasp'd the guilty game;

line_1: Cheer'd the gay pack, and grasp'd the guilty game;
line_2: Pleas'd with each passion, I pursu'd their aim,

line_1: Revell'd regardless, leap'd reflection o'er,
line_2: 'Till youth, 'till health, fame, fortune, are no more:

line_1: 'Till youth, 'till health, fame, fortune, are no more:
line_2: Revell'd regardless, leap'd reflection o'er,

line_1: Too late I feel the thought-corroding pain
line_2: Of sharp remembrance, and severe disdain:

line_1: Of sharp remembrance, and severe disdain:
line_2: Too late I feel the thought-corroding pain

line_1: Each painted pleasure its avenger breeds;
line_2: Sorrow's sad train, to riot's troop succeeds:

line_1: Sorrow's sad train, to riot's troop succeeds:
line_2: Each painted pleasure its avenger breeds;

line_1: Slow wasting sickness steals on swift debauch;
line_2: Contempt on pride, pale wants on waste approach.

line_1: Contempt on pride, pale wants on waste approach.
line_2: Slow wasting sickness steals on swift debauch;

line_1: Scorn'd by the sad, the cynie, and the dull,
line_2: The wou'd-be wit, and milky minded fool.

line_1: The wou'd-be wit, and milky minded fool.
line_2: Scorn'd by the sad, the cynie, and the dull,

line_1: Eternal Good! from Thee our hope descends;
line_2: With Thee it centers, and in Thee it ends:

line_1: With Thee it centers, and in Thee it ends:
line_2: Eternal Good! from Thee our hope descends;

line_1: To Thee, with shame-torn heart, I trembling kneel;
line_2: Heal me with mercy; oh! my Saviour, heal!

line_1: Heal me with mercy; oh! my Saviour, heal!
line_2: To Thee, with shame-torn heart, I trembling kneel;

line_1: Great Lord of life, if daring I request,
line_2: Still let me sigh among mankind unbless'd;

line_1: Still let me sigh among mankind unbless'd;
line_2: Great Lord of life, if daring I request,

line_1: Still sickness, shipwrecks, prisons, plagues to know;
line_2: Whate'er my fate is — still my faith's in you:

line_1: Whate'er my fate is — still my faith's in you:
line_2: Still sickness, shipwrecks, prisons, plagues to know;

line_1: Still shall thy name attune thy suppliant's song;
line_2: Still shall thy praise dwell rapt'rous on his tongue

line_1: Still shall thy praise dwell rapt'rous on his tongue
line_2: Still shall thy name attune thy suppliant's song;

line_1: Wretched or bless'd, still shall I always own,
line_2: Whate'er I feel, Heav'n's holy will be done.
